intro: Laugieria edechia, commonly known as the golden spire orchid, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It is characterized by its tall, slender stem and clusters of bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments with well-drained soil, often found in rocky crevices. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it has a symbiotic relationship with specific mycorrhizal fungi. Due to habitat loss, Laugieria edechia is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation programs.
